snippet.title: Frank Aukofer | 2010 Honda Insight
snippet.description: Honda is nothing if not competitive. The company determined to deliver a hybrid for the masses, priced well below the popular Toyota Prius. The result is the new Insight. The great hybrid war started at a time when hardly anybody cared. Honda, the pioneer in hybrid automobiles back

snippet.title: Mark Savage | Honda's Insight is reasonable knockoff of the Prius
snippet.description: The Honda Insight hybrid handles well, but it faces tough comparisons against its chief competitor, the Toyota Prius. Honda isn't trying very hard to hide that its new Insight hybrid is a knockoff of the better-selling Toyota Prius. It has virtually stolen its styling, meaning the two hybrids are easily

snippet.title: Honda's hybrid pricing gambit
snippet.description: Hondaâ€™s much-anticipated Prius fighter might double as a recession fighter. The Japanese automaker said Tuesday that when the 2010 Honda Insight hybrid hits dealer lots in two weeks, it will carry a base price of $19,800. That puts an end to months of speculation over just how much

snippet.title: Earth Day events to focus on 'green' vehicles
snippet.description: Alternative vehicles will be on display during Earth Week events at the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater and Milwaukee Area Technical College. "Sustainability in the Marketplace" will be the theme the UW-Whitewater Earth Day on April 22. The event will feature a presentation by Sonya Newenhouse, founder and president
